• , 4+ years of relevant biotechnology or pharmaceutical industry experience.
• Experience in a process or product development role, especially technology transfer to manufacturing and/or QC groups.
• Proficient in standard molecular biology techniques such as sample preparation, nucleic acid amplification and purification (RNA/DNA), and DNA/RNA in situ hybridization experience.
• Light and fluorescent microscopy experience.
• Experience with experimental design and statistical data analysis.
• Experience troubleshooting molecular biology-based assays and issues with reagent quality (manufacturing process, QC and stability).
• Experience generating reports/presentations and forecasting reagent usage and costs.
• Strong collaboration and communication skills.

• Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field anticipated to graduate in May 2027.
• Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
• Experience with PySpark/Spark is a plus.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills.
• Hands-on experience with real alternative datasets and AI tools used in financial research.
• Experience with LLM orchestration frameworks like LangChain or LangGraph.
• Prior experience in data testing, anomaly detection, or production-quality code.
• Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Databricks) and distributed data processing.

job_title: Data Scientist - AI / Machine Learning / Python / Weather Prediction
job_description:
• Proven experience in a technical role using AI/ML for geophysical prediction (especially weather).
• Experience running, validating, and fine-tuning AI/ML and foundation models.
• Ability to adapt open-source software for business needs.
• PhD in a relevant geophysical field (or equivalent experience).
• Experience training AI/ML models from scratch.
• Background in satellite data analysis or signal processing (GNSS/radar).
• Deep knowledge of both data science and a geophysical science (meteorology is a plus).
• Proficiency in Python (or similar) in a Linux environment.

• 2+ years of professional or academic experience working with data pipelines, analysis, or dashboardsProficiency in Python and SQLExperience using Databricks, Power BI, or similar tools for data modeling and visualizationExcellent communication and organizational skills to support client meetings and deliverables, and explain technical concepts/solutions to non-technical stakeholdersEffective time management and ability to adapt to changing prioritiesExperience with large scale data analytics frameworks such as Apache SparkExperience working with Azure Databricks and one or more Azure specialty certifications (SysOps Administrator, Security, Advanced Networking, DevOps Engineer, Administration, Architecture)Proficiency in working with tools such as Docker and KubernetesProficiency with cloud networking (DNS, TCP, Firewalls, Proxy Servers, Load Balancing, VPN, and VPC), storage, security, and computeExperience working with and supporting Agile development teams.
• Support client projects across energy, electrification, and DER domains through:Data Engineering: Ingest, clean, and transform large datasets using Python, SQL, and DatabricksData Science & Analytics: Conduct exploratory analysis, build analytical models, and generate actionable insightsData Visualization: Develop clear, compelling dashboards and reports in Power BI and Microsoft FabricAttend regular client meetings and collaborate with project managers to understand goals, manage timelines, and incorporate feedbackTranslate client requirements into well-structured analytics tasks and deliverablesWrite clean, maintainable, and well-documented code while optimizing workflows for performance and scalabilityManage and prioritize a diverse set of technical assignments across multiple projectsWork with cross-functional teams including data engineers, scientists, and policy experts to ensure high-quality client deliverablesStay up to date on tools, trends, and best practices in energy analytics and visualization Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
• Ability to learn quickly, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the cloud/IT technology space.

• Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a related field and a minimum of 3 years of professional experienceProven experience with predictive modeling, time series forecasting, pricing algorithms, or classification modelsStrong Python skills for statistical modeling and knowledge of modern ML platforms (e.
• PyTorch/TensorFlow, scikit-learn)Advanced SQL and experience working with large-scale cloud data warehouses (Redshift, Snowflake, etc.
• )Experience deploying models in production environments (using tools like Airflow, dbt, or AWS), knowledge of machine learning model evaluation, and performance tuning best practicesFamiliarity with software development workflows (version control, code review, reproducibility)Strong written and verbal communication skills—able to clearly explain models to non-technical audiencesComfort working with ambiguity, unstructured problems, and evolving data sources Improve fleet demand forecasting modelsBuild new predictive models for pricing sensitivity, member segmentation, and campaign targetingCollaborate with Product, Pricing, Operations, Finance, and Marketing to integrate modeling into decision-makingTranslate complex modeling outcomes into clear, actionable recommendationsMonitor model performance, retrain as needed, and manage model lifecycle in productionPartner with Engineering to move models from prototype to production and partner with the Product team to prioritize future enhancementsBuild trust in modeling outputs by documenting assumptions, limitations, and performanceEvangelize data science best practices across the company and help level up analytical maturity Experience with geospatial modeling, especially using Uber’s H3 libraryExperience using Looker or other BI tools for exploratory data analysis or visualizationBackground in transportation, location planning, urban analytics, or consumer marketplacesExperience mentoring other Analysts or acting as a tech leadCuriosity and interest in leveraging AI and LLM tools to improve workflows.

• Degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, economics, applied math, operations research or engineering (advanced degrees preferred), or relevant work experience3+ years of industry experience in a data science, analytics, or management consulting role.
• End-to-end experience with data, including querying, aggregation, analysis, and visualizationAbility to manage, influence, negotiate, and inspire others in a fast-moving environmentProficiency in SQL and PythonStrong oral and written communication skills, and ability to collaborate with cross-functional partners Leverage data and analytic frameworks to identify opportunities for growth and efficiency Partner with product managers, engineers, marketers, designers, and operators to translate data insights into decisions and actionConstruct and fit statistical, machine learning, or optimization modelsDesign and analyze online experiments.
• Communicate results and act on launch decisionsDevelop analytical frameworks to monitor business and product performanceEstablish metrics that measure the health of our products, the business, as well as the driver experience.

• Apply expert knowledge in data science to deliver solutions that address clients' business needs.
• This role requires a self-driven individual capable of working under minimal supervision, with a strong ability to translate raw data into concise and actionable insights.
• You will work closely with clients, managers, and technical staff to understand business needs and deliver effective, data-driven solutions that enhance decision-making and operational effectiveness.
• Company Stock Ownership: all employees are provided with shares of the company each year based on company value and profits.
• A current TS/SCI with Polygraph is required for this role.
• Experience using large data sets to solve problems.
• Knowledge of and experience with machine learning, data wrangling, advanced statistical data analysis and modeling.
• AWS or Cloud experience.

• Experience with GitHub workflows.
• Excellent English communication skills for video collaboration.
• Proficiency in Python, React and Django.
